text: David Starkey CBE FSA (born 3 January 1945) is a British historian. He is also a presenter on television and radio. His main topic is the British Royal Family. Starkey was born in Kendal, Westmorland. He studied at Kendal Grammar School and at Fitzwilliam College, Cambridge, where he gained a PhD. In the early 1970s he moved to London, where he became a teacher. Starkey's television work includes: The Six Wives of Henry VIII, Monarchy by David Starkey, The Tudors, Henry VIII: The Mind of a Tyrant and The Churchills. ==Personal life== Starkey lives in Highgate, London and Kent. He is an atheist.The people who oppose gay marriage He is openly gay and lived with his partner James Brown. James Brown died in 2015. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:BBC radio presenters Category:English historians Category:British radio personalities Category:British teachers Category:English atheists Category:English television presenters Category:English television writers Category:Gay men Category:LGBT broadcasters Category:English LGBT writers Category:People from Cumbria
title: David Starkey
